import numpy as np
from torch.nn.modules.loss import _Loss
import segmentation_models_pytorch as smp
{% endraw %} {% raw %}

class SoftDiceLoss[source]

SoftDiceLoss() :: Module

Base class for all neural network modules.

Your models should also subclass this class.

Modules can also contain other Modules, allowing to nest them in a tree structure. You can assign the submodules as regular attributes::

import torch.nn as nn
import torch.nn.functional as F

class Model(nn.Module):
    def __init__(self):
        super(Model, self).__init__()
        self.conv1 = nn.Conv2d(1, 20, 5)
        self.conv2 = nn.Conv2d(20, 20, 5)

    def forward(self, x):
        x = F.relu(self.conv1(x))
        return F.relu(self.conv2(x))

Submodules assigned in this way will be registered, and will have their parameters converted too when you call :meth:to, etc.

:ivar training: Boolean represents whether this module is in training or evaluation mode. :vartype training: bool

{% endraw %} {% raw %}
{% endraw %} {% raw %}

import torch.nn as nn

    def __init__(self):
        super(Model, self).__init__()
        self.conv1 = nn.Conv2d(1, 20, 5)
        self.conv2 = nn.Conv2d(20, 20, 5)

    def forward(self, x):
        x = F.relu(self.conv1(x))
        return F.relu(self.conv2(x))

Submodules assigned in this way will be registered, and will have their parameters converted too when you call :meth:to, etc.

:ivar training: Boolean represents whether this module is in training or evaluation mode. :vartype training: bool

In this module there are various loss functions for binary and instance segmentation.

{% raw %} 
device = torch.device("cuda" if torch.cuda.is_available() else "cpu")
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
dls = get_segmnt_dls(bs=4, device=device)

x, targs = dls.train.one_batch()
x.shape, targs.shape

(torch.Size([4, 3, 256, 1600]), torch.Size([4, 4, 256, 1600]))
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
x.device, targs.device

(device(type='cuda', index=0), device(type='cpu'))
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
model = smp.Unet("resnet18", 
                 encoder_weights="imagenet", 
                 classes=4, 
                 activation=None).to(device)
logits = model(x)
probs = torch.sigmoid(logits)
preds = ( probs > 0.5).float()
preds.shape

torch.Size([4, 4, 256, 1600])
{% endraw %}

BCE and SoftDice loss

In this section there are some loss functions used by @khornlund in his repository for the Severstal competition.

{% raw %} 
def bce_loss(output, target):
    """BCE with logits from Pytorch."""
    return F.binary_cross_entropy_with_logits(output, target)
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
t_logits, t_targs = torch.Tensor(logits.float().cpu()), torch.Tensor(targs.float())
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
bce_loss(t_logits, t_targs)

tensor(0.8846, grad_fn=<BinaryCrossEntropyWithLogitsBackward>)
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
BCEWithLogitsLossFlat(axis=1)(t_logits, t_targs)

TensorBase(0.8846, grad_fn=<AliasBackward>)
{% endraw %} {% raw %}

SoftDiceLoss() :: Module

Base class for all neural network modules.

Your models should also subclass this class.

Modules can also contain other Modules, allowing to nest them in a tree structure. You can assign the submodules as regular attributes::

import torch.nn as nn
import torch.nn.functional as F

class Model(nn.Module):
    def __init__(self):
        super(Model, self).__init__()
        self.conv1 = nn.Conv2d(1, 20, 5)
        self.conv2 = nn.Conv2d(20, 20, 5)

    def forward(self, x):
        x = F.relu(self.conv1(x))
        return F.relu(self.conv2(x))

loss = SoftDiceLoss()
loss(t_logits, t_targs)

class MultiClassesSoftBCEDiceLoss[source]

import torch.nn as nn

    def __init__(self):
        super(Model, self).__init__()
        self.conv1 = nn.Conv2d(1, 20, 5)
        self.conv2 = nn.Conv2d(20, 20, 5)

    def forward(self, x):

        return F.relu(self.conv2(x))

loss = MultiClassesSoftBCEDiceLoss()

{% endraw %} {% raw %}

class IoULoss[source]

IoULoss(eps:float=1e-07, threshold:float=None) :: Module

Intersection over union (Jaccard) loss Args: eps (float): epsilon to avoid zero division threshold (float): threshold for outputs binarization activation (str): An torch.nn activation applied to the outputs. Must be one of ['none', 'Sigmoid', 'Softmax2d']

{% endraw %} {% raw %}
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
loss = IoULoss()
loss(t_logits, t_targs)

tensor(0.9924, grad_fn=<RsubBackward1>)
{% endraw %}
